1.text: And the festival of unleavened drew near, called the Pascha.

2.text: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him; for they feared the people.

3.text: And Satan came into Judas called Iscariot, being of the number of the twelve.

4.text: And having departed, he conversed with the chief priests and the generals, how he might deliver him to them.

5.text: And they rejoiced, and agreed to give him silver.

6.text: And he promised, and sought an opportunity to deliver him to them apart from the crowd.

7.text: And the day of unleavened came, in which must be sacrificed the pascha.

8.text: And he sent Peter and John, saying, Having gone, prepare ye for us the pascha, that we might eat.

9.text: And they said to him, Where wilt thou that we should prepare?

10.text: And he said to them, Behold, you having come to the city, there shall a man meet you, bearing an earthen vessel of water; follow ye him to the house where he goes in.

11.text: And ye shall say to the master of the house, The Teacher says to thee, Where is the room where I should eat the pascha with my disciples?

12.text: And he shall shew you a great upper room spread: there prepare ye.

13.text: And having departed, they found as he said to them; and they prepared the pascha.

14.text: And when it was the hour, he reclined, and the twelve sent with him.

15.text: And he said to them, With eager desire have I desired to eat this pascha with you before I suffer:

16.text: For I say to you, no more should I eat of it, till when it should be completed in the kingdom of God.

17.text: Having taken the cup, and returned thanks, he said, Take this, and divide among yourselves:

18.text: For I say to you, that I drink not of the fruit of the vine, till when the kingdom of God comes.

19.text: Having taken the bread, and returned thanks, he brake, and gave them, saying, This is my body given for you: this do ye for my remembrance.

20.text: Likewise also the cup after supping, saying, This the cup, the new covenant in my blood, poured out for you:

21.text: But, behold, the hand of him delivering me up with me at the table.

22.text: And truly the Son of man goes according to that determined: but woe to that man by whom he is delivered up!

23.text: And they began to seek together among themselves, which of them it should be that was about to do this thing.

24.text: And a love of strife was in them, which of them thinks to be the greater.

25.text: And he said to them, The kings of the nations rule over them; and they exercising power over them are called benefactors.

26.text: And ye not so: but let the greater with you be as the younger; and he leading, as he serving.

27.text: For which the greater, he reclining, or he serving? is not he reclining and I am in the midst of you as he serving.

28.text: And ye are they having remained with me in my temptations.

29.text: And I set to you, as my Father set to me, a kingdom;

30.text: That ye might eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and might sit upon thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

31.text: And the Lord said, Simon, Simon, behold, Satan has demanded you, to sift as wheat:

32.text: And I have supplicated for thee that thy faith fail not: and thou, when having turned back, confirm thy brethren.

33.text: And he said to him, Lord, with thee am I ready to go, and to prison, and to death.

34.text: And he said, I say to thee, Peter, the cock shall not utter a sound this day, before thou shalt thrice deny knowing me.

35.text: And he said to them, When I sent you without purse, and wallet, and shoes, did ye want any thing? And they said, Nothing,

36.text: Then said he to them, But now, he having a purse, let him take up, and likewise a wallet: and he not having, let him sell his garment, and buy a sword.

37.text: For I say to you, that this written must yet be finished in me, that, Also was he reckoned with the lawless: for also the things concerning me have an end.

38.text: And they said, Lord, behold, two swords here. And he said to them, It is enough.

39.text: And having come out, he went, according to custom, to the mount of Olives; and his disciples followed him.

40.text: And being at the place, he said to them, Pray ye not to enter into temptation.

41.text: And he was removed from them about a stoneâ€™s cast, and having placed the knees, he prayed,

42.text: Saying, Father, If thou art willing, turn aside this cup from me: but not my will, but thine, be done.

43.text: And a messenger was seen to him from heaven, strengthening him.

44.text: And being in a violent struggle, he prayed more intently: and his sweat was as clots of blood coming down upon the earth.

45.text: And having risen from prayer, having come to his disciples, he found them sleeping from grief;

46.text: And he said to them, Why sleep ye? having risen, pray that ye might not enter into temptation.

47.text: And he yet speaking, Behold a crowd, and he called Judas, one of the twelve, came before them, and drew near to Jesus to kiss him.

48.text: And Jesus said to him, Judas, deliverest thou up the Son of man with a kiss?

49.text: And they about him, having seen that, going to be, said to him, Lord, shall we strike with the sword.

50.text: And a certain one of them struck a servant of the chief priest, and took away his right ear.

51.text: And Jesus having answered said, Allow ye even to this. And having touched his ear, he healed him.

52.text: And Jesus said to the chief priests, and generals of the temple, and the elders, having come to him, Have ye come out, as upon a robber, with sword and sticks?

53.text: I being with you daily in the temple, ye stretched not forth the hands upon me: but this is your hour, and the power of darkness.

54.text: And having taken, they brought him into the house of the chief priest. And Peter followed him far off.

55.text: And having kindled a fire in the midst of the hall, and they having sat down together, Peter sat down in the midst of them.

56.text: And a certain young girl having seen him sitting by the light, and looked intently upon him, said, And this was with him.

57.text: And he denied him, saying, Woman, I know him not.

58.text: And after a little another having seen him, said, Thou art also of them. And Peter said, Man, I am not.

59.text: And about the space of one hour a certain other assured himself, saying, of a truth this also was with him: for he is a Galilean.

60.text: And Peter said, Man, I know not what thou sayest. And immediately, he yet speaking, the cock uttered a sound.

61.text: And the Lord having turned, looked upon Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he said to him, That before the cock utters a sound, thou shalt deny me thrice.

62.text: And Peter having come forth without wept bitterly.

63.text: And the men holding Jesus mocked him, stripping.

64.text: And having covered him, they struck his face, and asked him, saying, Prophesy who it is having struck thee.

65.text: And many other things, blaspheming, they spake against him.

66.text: And when it was day, the council of elders of the people was gathered together, and the chief priests and scribes, and they brought him to their council,

67.text: Saying, Art thou Christ? tell us. And he said to them, If I tell you, ye would not believe:

68.text: And if I ask you, ye would not answer me, or loose me.

69.text: From now shall the Son of man be sitting from the right hand of the power of God.

70.text: And they all said, Art thou therefore the Son of God? And he said to them, Ye say that I am.

71.text: And they said, Why have we yet need of testimony? for we ourselves have heard from his month.
